trans-unit.source: Provides support for rapid application development (RAD) designers to parse data-binding expressions that use XPath expressions.
This class cannot be inherited.

You can use the overloaded <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Eval%2A> method of this class to bind to the result of an XPath expression executed against an object that implements the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> interface, such as an <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode>.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Select%2A> method to retrieve the results of an XPath expression executed against an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object as an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> list of nodes.

This list of nodes can be enumerated directly or assigned to the `DataSource` property of a list control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Repeater> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList>.
You can use a simplified version of data-binding syntax when using the XPathBinder methods declaratively.
Instead of calling `XPathBinder.Eval`(`Container.DataItem`, `xpath`) you can use `XPath`(`xpath`).
Similarly, instead of calling `XPathBinder.Select`(`Container.DataItem`,`xpath`), you can use `XPathSelect`(`xpath`) to retrieve an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> set of nodes.
When using this simplified syntax, the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Eval%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Select%2A> methods assume a default `Container.DataItem` context object.
For more information about data binding to ASP.NET server controls, see [Data-Binding Expression Syntax](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/676beb1d-ddfa-4153-bba8-3c86dcb7ceca).
Evaluates XPath data-binding expressions at run time.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
This must be a valid object identifier in the page's specified language.
The XPath query from `container` to the property value that is placed in the bound control property.
An <xref:System.Object> that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.
The container or xpath parameter is .
The object specified by container is not an object.
Evaluates XPath data-binding expressions at run time and formats the result as text to be displayed in the requesting browser.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
This must be a valid object identifier in the page's specified language.
The XPath query from the `container` to the property value to be placed in the bound control property.

A .NET Framework format string, similar to those used by <xref:System.String.Format%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, that converts the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object (which results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression) to a <xref:System.String> that can be displayed by the requesting browser.
A <xref:System.String> that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression and conversion to a string type.
The container or xpath parameter is .
The object specified by container is not an .

Evaluates XPath data-binding expressions at run time and formats the result as text to be displayed in the requesting browser, using the <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object specified to resolve namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
This must be a valid object identifier in the page's specified language.
The XPath query from the `container` to the property value to be placed in the bound control property.
The <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object used to resolve namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
A <xref:System.Object> that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.

Evaluates XPath data-binding expressions at run time and formats the result as text to be displayed in the requesting browser, using the <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object specified to resolve namespace prefixes in the XPath expression..
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
This must be a valid object identifier in the page's specified language.
The XPath query from the `container` to the property value to be placed in the bound control property.

A .NET Framework format string, similar to those used by <xref:System.String.Format%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, that converts the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object (which results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression) to a <xref:System.String> that can be displayed by the requesting browser.
The <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object used to resolve namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
A <xref:System.String> that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression and conversion to a string type.
Uses an XPath data-binding expression at run time to return a list of nodes.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
This must be a valid object identifier in the page's specified language.
The XPath query that retrieves a list of nodes.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> list of nodes.
The container or xpath parameter is .
The object specified by container is not an .
The current node of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNodeIterator"></xref> does not have an associated XML node.
Uses an XPath data-binding expression at run time to return a list of nodes, using the <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object specified to resolve namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable"></xref> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
This must be a valid object identifier in the page's specified language.
The XPath query that retrieves a list of nodes.
The <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object used to resolve namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> list of nodes.
